tool.name: PointsToLineEvents

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: A point feature layer containing an even number of features.
param.pythonReference: A point feature layer containing an even number of features.

param.name: in_routes
param.dialogReference: A feature layer containing route polylines.
param.pythonReference: A feature layer containing route polylines.

param.name: route_id_field
param.dialogReference: The field in the route layer that contains a unique route identifier.
param.pythonReference: The field in the route layer that contains a unique route identifier.

param.name: radius
param.dialogReference: The distance to search around the input points for a nearby route feature.
param.pythonReference: The distance to search around the input points for a nearby route feature.

param.name: out_table
param.dialogReference: The path to where the output table will be written.
param.pythonReference: The path to where the output table will be written.

tool.summary: Given a point layer with an even number of rows, where every other row represents a start and end point, locates line segments that start and end at those points.

scriptExample.title: Example1
scriptExample.para: Sample showing how to use as a script

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Given a point layer with an even number of rows, where every other row represents a start and end point, locates line segments that start and end at those points.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created for WSDOT by Jeff Jacobson
